newsitem.title: USA: NJ Salem 2 nuke still testing pending NRC approval.
newsitem.headline: NJ Salem 2 nuke still testing pending NRC approval.

text.p: Public Service Electric & Gas Co (PSE&G) said it continues to conduct startup testing at the Salem 2 nuclear power unit as it awaits restart approval from the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC).
"We're still going through plant testing," a PSE&G spokeswoman said Friday, adding testing may last another week or two.

In a June 27 letter to NRC's regional chief, PSE&G said the 1,106 megawatt (MW) unit in southern New Jersey is ready to restart after being shut more than two years to address safety concerns raised by the commission.
"The plant is physically ready to restart," the spokeswoman said.
PSE&G, in the letter, said Salem 2 is ready for restart and could enter into startup mode on or about Saturday.
An NRC spokeswoman said the commission's regional administrator will unlikely give go-ahead for Salem 2 to restart over the weekend.
NRC earlier said the regional chief would grant restart clearance by the end of the month.
The adjoining Salem unit 1, also at 1,108 MW, remained down and tentatively set return to service in autumn.
In addition to PSE&G, owners of Salem are PECO Energy Co, Delmarva Power & Light Co and Atlantic Energy Co.
